title: On neurological level, what does it mean if something can't be unseen? - Quora

response.answer_text: The term really only has a colloquial meaning. It means that when you see something — typically something horrific, gruesome or disgusting — it sticks in your memory. On a neural level all we can say is that long-term memory systems are involved if you really do remember it weeks or months later.
Here’s one example: i hallucinate as part of my seizure. Let’s say I hallucinate a face. I can’t unsee it. I can turn, close my eyes, etc…it’s still there. It can’t be unseen.
